intro: Wilhelmsia physodes, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces showy blooms during the spring and early summer. It is adapted to survive in hot, dry environments and requires well-drained soil. Wilhelmsia physodes is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in xeriscaped gardens.
